questions.question: What does HTML stand for?
questions.answer: HyperText Markup Language

questions.question: Which HTML tag is used to create a hyperlink?
Which tag is used to insert an image in HTML?
What is the purpose of the <head> tag in HTML?
questions.answer: It contains metadata and links to scripts and stylesheets.

questions.question: What attribute is used to provide alternative text for an image?
questions.answer: alt
Cascading Style Sheets

questions.question: Which property is used to change the text color in CSS?
questions.answer: color

questions.question: How do you select an element with the ID 'main' in CSS?
questions.answer: #main

questions.question: Which CSS property controls the size of text?
questions.answer: font-size

questions.question:
How do you make all `

` elements have no margin?
questions.answer: p { margin: 0; }

questions.question: Agile Manifesto
questions.answer: A foundational document in Agile development that emphasizes values like individuals and interactions, working software, customer collaboration, and responding to change.

questions.question: Agility
questions.answer: The ability to respond rapidly and adaptively to change through communication, collaboration, and incremental delivery.

questions.question: Customer Collaboration
questions.answer: Continuous involvement of the customer as part of the Agile team to ensure alignment with user needs.

questions.question: Working Software
questions.answer: The primary measure of progress in Agile, preferred over detailed documentation.

questions.question: Self-Organizing Teams
questions.answer: Teams that manage their own work, make decisions collaboratively, and adapt to challenges independently.

questions.question: Extreme Programming (XP)
questions.answer: An Agile methodology focused on practices like user stories, pair programming, refactoring, and continuous testing.

questions.question: Project Velocity
questions.answer: A metric in XP that tracks the number of features delivered per iteration to help estimate future progress.

questions.question: Adaptive Software Development (ASD)
questions.answer: An Agile approach that emphasizes mission-driven planning, component-based development, time-boxing, and learning.

questions.question: Dynamic Systems Development Method (DSDM)
questions.answer: An Agile method focusing on active user involvement, iterative development, frequent delivery, and integrated testing.

questions.question: Scrum
questions.answer: An Agile framework that organizes work into time-boxed sprints, with regular demos and a product backlog.

questions.question: Crystal Methodology
questions.answer: A family of Agile methods tailored by project size and criticality, emphasizing communication and reflection.

questions.question: Feature-Driven Development (FDD)
questions.answer: An Agile methodology based on building client-valued features, each deliverable in two weeks or less.

questions.question: Agile Modeling
questions.answer: A practice promoting purposeful, lightweight modeling with adaptability and multiple model types.

questions.question: Agile-Scrum
questions.answer: The combination of Agile principles with the structured framework of Scrum for project management and delivery.

sections.title: JavaScript Overview
bullets: JavaScript is primarily used to add interactivity and dynamic behavior to websites.
Common keywords for declaring variables: let, const, or var.
Expression '2' + 2 results in '22' due to string concatenation.
Functions can be defined using: function myFunction() { }
The addEventListener method attaches an event handler to an element.

sections.title: Web Accessibility Essentials
bullets: WCAG stands for Web Content Accessibility Guidelines.
Alt text describes images for screen readers and improves accessibility.
The aria-label attribute helps screen readers understand the purpose of a link.
Use heading tags (h1â€“h6) in order to provide a logical structure for screen readers.
Color contrast ensures readability for users with visual impairments.

sections.title: The Agile Manifesto
bullets: Individuals and interactions over processes and tools.
Working software over comprehensive documentation.
Customer collaboration over contract negotiation.
Responding to change over following a plan.

sections.title: Core Aspects of Agility
bullets: Agility is the ability to respond rapidly and adaptively to change.
Encourages effective communication among stakeholders.
Involves the customer as part of the team.
Teams are self-organizing and in control of their work.
Focuses on rapid, incremental software delivery.

sections.title: Principles of Agile Development
bullets: Early and continuous delivery of valuable software.
Embrace changing requirements even late in development.
Deliver working software frequently.
Daily collaboration between business and developers.
Projects are built around motivated individuals.
Face-to-face communication is most effective.
Working software is the primary measure of progress.
Sustainable development pace is maintained.
Continuous attention to technical excellence and good design.
Simplicity is essential.
Self-organizing teams yield the best outcomes.
Teams reflect and adapt regularly.

sections.title: Human Factors in Agile Teams
bullets: Competence, common focus, and collaboration are essential.
Teams should have decision-making ability and mutual trust.
Teams must be self-organizing and adaptable to ambiguity.

sections.title: Agile Methodologies
bullets: Extreme Programming (XP): User stories, refactoring, pair programming, unit testing.
Adaptive Software Development (ASD): Time-boxing, risk awareness, mission-driven planning.
Dynamic Systems Development Method (DSDM): Iterative development, active user involvement, integrated testing.
Scrum: Sprints, daily stand-ups, backlog-driven work, time-boxed demos.
Crystal: Tailored to team size and project complexity, promotes face-to-face communication and reflection.
Feature-Driven Development (FDD): Features defined using templates, 'design and build' merged.
Agile Modeling: Model with purpose, keep it lightweight, adapt to local context.
Agile-Scrum: Combines agile values with Scrum's structured roles and events.
